page.title: 15HOUSING AROUND SHAWBURY
page.content: {DAWSONS ROUGH}This comprises 52 houses,31 built in 1952, and 21 in 1974,all classed by the RAF as public married accomodation for RAF personnel.122 family members live there and the average stay is 2 1/2 years. {MYTTON ESTATE }Built in 1968, this estate comprises houses, bungalows and chalet bungalows.There are about 1oo houses and most people have lived here for more than 8 years.It lies on the outskirts of{Shawbury,}on what used to be a poulty farm. {EDGEBOLTON }A hamlet about one k/metre from Shawbury depending on the village for all amenities. The houses are mixed in age and style, being mainly older.It is a{Saxon}settlement,and was once larger than Shawbury.{William {Hazledine,}the iron founder who worked with{Telford}was born here.
